doc:div.p: This page describes how to install the RabbitMQ server under Mac OS X using MacPorts.

MacPorts is an easy-to-use system for installing open-source software onto Mac OS X computers. The MacPorts community has packaged thousands of projects as ports, including the RabbitMQ server. So once you have installed MacPorts, installing the RabbitMQ server takes just a single command:
See the MacPorts website for more information about MacPorts.

doc:section.name: repo
doc:section.doc:heading: Using the rabbitmq.com ports repository to install the latest server release
doc:section.p: When a new version of the RabbitMQ server is released, it can take some time for the version included in the main collection of MacPorts packages to be updated. So we provide a special-purpose MacPorts repository to give OS X users easy access to the very latest release of the RabbitMQ server.
Once you have installed MacPorts, enable the rabbitmq.com repository as follows:

ol.li:
Open /opt/local/etc/macports/sources.conf in a text editor, and add the following http: URL before the existing rsync: URL like so:
http://www.rabbitmq.com/releases/macports rsync://rsync.macports.org/release/ports/ [default]
Use the following command to cause MacPorts to retrieve the package indices from the newly-added repository:
sudo port sync
If the rabbitmq.com repository has a newer version of the RabbitMQ server than the main MacPorts one, this should now be visible when in the results of the port search command:
sudo port search rabbitmq-server
Which, for example, might produce:
rabbitmq-server @1.7.0 (net) The RabbitMQ AMQP Server
rabbitmq-server @1.7.1 (net) The RabbitMQ AMQP Server
Found 2 ports.
You can now install the latest release of rabbitmq-server with the command:
sudo port install rabbitmq-server
